content.body: Also, serif fonts generally deviate very little from Times Roman. most people would not really notice the difference between `serif`, Times New Roman, Palatino Linotype, etc. They all look kinda the same... like a printed (non-tech) book or newspaper. IBM Plex Serif has a distinctly different look-n-feel, which (sample size of 1) makes it a bit harder for me to quickly scan and read prose in the spec.

content.body: That said, I think the new fonts are more readable for `<code>` elements and headings. My main concerns are the left pane and regular prose.
